reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game was apparently so badly written in the first place that it has taken years of rewriting it inside out just to get to the point where it's maintainable, in all that time there have been no notable additions to the game.

After those years of improvements, the game is still feels laggy with a Core i5 and 16 GB of RAM.

Support for non-QWERTY keyboards is terrible, don't let them tell you otherwise. They seem to think they fixed this problem based on feedback from their support team, but it's still broken.

Support for Linux is non-existent, the game has crashed ever since it was supposed to work and it's not likely to ever change.

These developers had a great idea, and no talent for execution. They hired a lot of new people to try and fix the game, but at this point I imagine they're going to run out of money before the game is any good.

Don't make the same mistake the kickstarter backers and the early access steam purchasers made. Save your money. If you're determined check this game out again in another 3-5 years to see if they ever actually finished it.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I really want to like this game. It's essentially a castle building/defence simulator that has potential in droves. However, the game faces problems in the AI and has not had any significant updates for ages. Castle Story's AI is servicable at best, but the 'bricktons' will constantly stop and admire the scenery. The AI is at it's worst when assigned to a building project. They will constantly build the closest block to them, meaning that quite regularly, they will completely freeze as their pathfinding spends time trying to redirect the brickton. This wastes precious time in survival mode when you are trying to set up defences before the next wave of enemies comes charging in.

The lack of updates makes it feel like the devs have almost abandoned the game, as in the past year there has been no significant update to the gameplay at all. The promise of world generator has been hovering around ever since I bought the game a year ago, but I have still to see any evidence of it being implemented into the game.

TL;DR : Game has large amount of potential but falls flat with buggy AI and lazy dev team

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I played the prototype a lot when it was released in mid October of 2012, before leaving it as there weren't many features. Nearly a year after that Castle story became available on Steam. I was excited to check it out to see the prgress that was made. Instead I was shocked to discover that it was nearly identicle to the prototype released a year prior. Fastforward to July 2014,  over 1.5 years since the release of the prototype, and next to no progress has been made at all. You would think in that time, with the funding they have received, they would be able to make at least some significant progress.
the game itself is sub-par. The contros are awkward, clunky and unresponsive. The building, while it requires somethinking in order to contruct buildings correctly, is boring and everything ends up looking the same as the most common material you will use are the stone blocks. Bricktrons are incredibly stupid, sometimes becoming frozen in place not responding to anything.
I regret kickstarting this game - I backed the kickstarter for ~$20. I can't recomend the game in its current state, which it looks set to be in for a long time in the future. Even if its on sale for 90% off it is still not worth it: there is no redeeming factors in it to make up for the monotony of the rest of the game. It's not so bad it's good, just plain boring. I hope that the game eventually becomes half decent, but I don't see that happening anytime soon if the development so far is anything to go by.
voteText: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Status as of 2014-07-19.


Cute game that has immense unrealized potential.
Minecraft de-light in RTS setting.

Features:
- 2 game modes: Survival, Sandbox, (currently editor is disabled)
- A few stone blocks & structures
- A few wooden blocks and structures
- Some awkward quasi-magical explosive devices.
- 3 units, worker, Melee, Archer
- 1 map (of questionable design)

Bugs:
- Very few, game has never crashed on me thus far.

Annoyances: (This is where the experience currently falls flat due to being an RTS)
- Clicking on unit does not always result in selection of said unit.
- Drag-select does nothing when beginning on anything but empty ground.
- Right-click to move, sometimes does nothing.
- Melee units does not always attack nearby units - even when attacked.
- LOS for Archers is not transparant.
- Archers will gladly shoot through friendly units, damaging or even killing them.
- Worker AI, while improving, is still frustrating. (Getting stuck, slow to respond, etc)
- Interface is clean but feels extremely clunky for some operations.


This game is very close to being worth a few bucks, but as it stands it gets boring within minutes. Beyond fixing the issues listed under Annoyances" the game needs a few more maps along with _at least_ one more game-mode(why not a assault the stronghold
recommended: or similar) before I would recommend it to anyone. The game is extremely charming and I really wish the developers would give it some more features before it becomes another "Towns"-vaporware-product.\n"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is a beautiful game with a lot of potential, but please pay attention to the disclaimer. The game is not finished yet and so far you will find a lot of bugs that make you avoid playing for a long time or even surviving a few waves. In my personal opinion, it has some major problems that make me think it's not a beta yet, but an advanced alpha.

The development team is working slowly on this game so, if you want to try it, perhaps you can add it to your wishlist and wait for a discount. So far the content is not worth 20 USD, maybe 10.

What do you can do right now?
-Play in just two scenarios, one for the sandbox mode and the other for survival.
-Develop your castle almost as you want to do it, with a few bugs that sometimes make your bricktrons do nothing but lay down until they are killed.
-Collect resources (wood, stone and blue/yellow cristals) pretty easily, but sometimes the  trees explode when you are collecting wood, so you have to wait until they decide they lost it and chop another tree.
-Kill the bad guys with archers and swordsmen to defend your fortress every few minutes. Sometimes they don't see  or they can't find the baddies, so if you don't notice them, they keep destroying your castle brick by brick until the guards decide to attack them.
-If one of your workers get stuck in a corner (like on the middle of four barrels), you can do nothing.
Creating more bricktrons is really slow, so when you loose some of them because of a bug, then each time is even harder to keep surviving and you can get bored.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is horrible. In the disclaimer it states, A not so buggy version of Survival mode that still needs some balancing" Well if by not buggy you mean it is playable to an extent then yes. But. The game has awful Framerate and randomly lags to the point where you cannot play the game anymore. I love the idea of the game and loved to see all the updates but in all the months I have had this game I have seen 2 updates. The first was a rewrite of the whole game to make it run better which does not seem to be very evident and the other update added the giant enemy that was advertised in the trailer. So really nothing has been added and this is very disappointing.

Oh and a god awful feature is that your archers will shoot each other if an enemy is infront of them. They have no decent AI in this game."

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis game is absolutely rubbish. They say that this is actually a working game, however, it couldn't be further from it. 12 Minutes was all I needed to see that these minions" have had no thought put into how they move and what they do. They become confused
date: the processes to make them do simple tasks are too clunky and complicated. They are too hard to operate with. I bought this game thinking I could use it for its primary purpose; to be played with.  However
recommended: it is a waste of money. Simply looking around the map area is a laborious task in itself. There is nothing about this game that is simply easy to do or fun. There are so many bugs and things to fix I couldn't keep playing it. There are no tutorials or anything to tell me how and what to do.\n\nEDIT: I recently downloaded the game again after quite a while of having it sit in my "NOT WANTED" category. It's still awful. Despite plenty of time and the graphics on "fantastic"
hoursPlayed: there are several graphical glitches
voteText: such as a lot of pixelation
helpfulPercent: missing textures and see-through blocks. It's like watching Youtube in 144p but worse. The controls are still too complex and overly sensitive. There's no tutorial that I could find and if you click the wrong thing
votesHelpful: there's no way to un-do it.\n\nFor the love of all that is good and holy don't buy this game. If you haven't
votesTotal:
bend down on one knee and thank Gaben by name. Just go buy Minecraft*.


*BUT NOT STORYMODE!"

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis game has been out for a very long time and at first it was very good however due to the lack of updates over the entire period this game has been out has been ridiculous. It is a good game however you would have played everything the game has to offer after a few hours.
